Package odase

The main ODASE API.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DatatypeConverter<T>
    A DatatypeConverter converts between Literals and a native Java type.
    HedwigModel
    Instances of this interface represent the state of some OWL+SWRL model.
    KnowledgeBaseOptions  
    Literal
    An RDF Literal.
    LiteralVisitor<T>
    Visitor for Literals.
    Model
    Instances of this interface represent the state of some OWL+SWRL model.
    ModelReadOnly
    Model exposing queries methods used by hedwig generated code and individual
    ModelUpdate
    Model exposing all the necessary updates on the abox level
    RdfNode
    Super interface of Resources and Literals.
    RdfNodeVisitor<T>
    Visitor for RDF Nodes.
    Resource
    An RDF URI or anonymous node.
    ResourceVisitor<T>
    Visitor for Resources.
    SwrlModel
    Some model on which a swrl query can be run against.
    TBoxModel
    TBoxModel allows to find ontology classes, properties, domain, range, etc.
    ValidatableModel
    Some model on which validation can be run.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ABoxReasonerConfig
    ABoxReasonerConfig is used to configure which OWL axioms are transformed into SWRL rules.
    AllOwlDlConfig
    This configuration causes all available OWL-DL reasoning to be done.
    AllOwlDlWithSwrlConfig
    This configuration causes all available OWL-DL reasoning to be done, plus parses any SWRL rules
    AllOwlFullConfig
    This configuration causes all available OWL-FULL reasoning to be done.
    AllOwlFullWithSwrlConfig
    This configuration causes all available OWL-FULL reasoning to be done, plus also parse normal SWRL rules.
    BaseDatatypeConverter<T>  
    CachingIndividualComparator<I extends Individual,V extends Comparable<V>>
    A class which caches results to getCompareValue()
    ConcurrentKnowledgeBase
    Concurrent ODASE implementation of the Model interface and provides access to a TBoxModel.
    CustomRdfDataStore  
    DatatypeRangeValuesCollection<T>
    DatatypeRangeValuesCollection is a collection representing the values of the range of a non-functional datatype property
    FastConfig
    This configuration is the default configuration used by the workbench.
    FastWithRangeConfig
    This configuration is the "fast_with_range" configuration used by the workbench.
    Individual
    An Individual is a Resource with an associated Model.
    IndividualComparator<I extends Individual,V extends Comparable<V>>
    An abstract class where you override getCompareValue() so that you can specify a custom sorting order for individuals.
    KnowledgeBase
    Default ODASE implementation of the Model interface and provides access to a TBoxModel.
    LiteralConverter
    An identity datatype converter for literals.
    LiteralUtil
    Utility methods for literals.
    LocaleIndividualComparator<I extends Individual>
    A comparator which compares two individuals by comparing the labels for the two individuals in the given Locale.
    LoggingConfiguration  
    ModelAdaptor
    This class implements most of the odase.Model methods in terms of other methods.
    ModelWrapper
    This class provides a wrapper around a Model.
    ObjectRangeValuesCollection<T extends Individual>
    ObjectRangeValuesCollection is a collection representing the values of the range of a non-functional object property
    OdaseProperties
    Configuration properties for ODASE.
    Ontology
    The Ontology class is used as the base class for classes generated with the Hedwig tool.
    PartialDatatypeConverter<T>
    PartialDatatypeConverter only covers basic types, not dates, if not supported, null is returned.
    QueryStats
    Instances of this class can be used to track basic query performance data.
    RdfDataStore
    RdfDataStore is an RDF store, which can be memory, DB, native, etc.
    RdfDataStore.RdfDataStoreURIResolver
    Is the object that decides on how to interpret a URI into a store
    RdfDataStoreGetter
    class containing static methods to construct rdf_data_store_getter objects to be used when constructing a KnowledgeBase, to provide custom rdf store getter.
    RdfDataStoreIntegration
    RdfDataStore that accepts updates
    RdfDataStoreUpdateable
    RdfDataStore that accepts updates
    RefModel
    A RefModel allows a Model to forward on all of its calls to another model which can be changed as required.
    ResourceUtil
    Utility functions for working with Resources.
    SimpleDatatypeConverter<T>
    A simple datatype converter that works for most common cases.
    StoresAndOntologies  
    TBoxModel.TBoxOwlClass
    TBoxOwlClass represents an owl Class on which tbox reasoning can be done
    TBoxModel.TBoxProperty
    TBoxProperty represents an owl property (data or object) on which tbox reasoning can be done
    UnzonedDateConverter
    A xsd:date -- Date DatatypeConverter which ignores the time zone from the Date object and put the default time zone in the Date object if the xsd:date has no time zone
    Variable
    A variable for use in queries.
    Version  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    MemoTableStratergy
    This enum represents the different types to handle a memo table in concurrent code.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DatatypeConversionException
    This exception is thrown when a native Java type cannot be converted to or from a literal.

Package odase Description

The main ODASE API. This package allows user written as well as generated code to connect to and interact with an ODASE (Ontology Driven Architecture for Software Engineering) backend. Here is a short description of the main ODASE classes and interfaces:
  • Model: This abstraction represents the current state of the ODASE backend model. It can be used to query and update the model. This interface is used by code generated with the Hedwig tool. Normally it is easier and safer to use the generated code to access the model, but it can also be used directly.
  • Resource: An abstraction representing an RDF URI or anonymous node. Resources are independent of any model.
  • Individual: A resource (URI or anonymous node) in the context of a particular model. Given an Individual you can query or update properties that have that individual as their subject. This is not the case with the Resource class, because a Resource object has no model associated with it. The Individual class is the base class for the generated Java classes that correspond to OWL classes.
